name: EHDSProcedure
title: Procedure model
description: EHDS refined base model for an action that is or was performed on or for a patient

element.short: Procedure model
element.definition: EHDS refined base model for an action that is or was performed on or for a patient

element.short: Common header for all patient-related data
element.definition: Common header for all patient-related data

element.short: Subject
element.definition: Patient/subject information

element.short: Business identifier for the object
element.definition: Business identifier for the object

element.short: Authorship
element.definition: Resource authoring details

element.short: Author
element.definition: Author(s) by whom the resource was/were authored. Multiple authors could be provided.

element.short: Date and time of authoring/issuing
element.definition: Date and time of the issuing the document/resource by its author.

element.short: Date and time of the last update to the resource
element.definition: Date and time of the last update to the document/information

element.short: Status of the resource
element.definition: Status of the resource

element.short: Reason for the current status of the resource.
element.definition: Reason for the current status of the resource.

element.short: Language
element.definition: Language in which the resource is written. Language is expressed by the IETF language tag.

element.short: Version
element.definition: Business version of the resource.

element.short: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document
element.definition: A narrative easy-to-read representation of the full data set, e.g. PDF-version of a document

element.short: Code identifying the procedure
element.definition: Code identifying the procedure

element.short: Date and time of the procedure or interval of its performance
element.definition: Date and time of the procedure or interval of its performance

element.short: An actor who performed the procedure
element.definition: An actor who performed the procedure

element.short: Procedure target body site. Details of where the procedure was performed. Laterality may be included as qualifier of the body site.
element.definition: Procedure target body site. Details of where the procedure was performed. Laterality may be included as qualifier of the body site.

element.short: The reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a concept from a terminology or a reference to a specific instance that describes the reason.
element.definition: The reason why the procedure was performed. This may be a concept from a terminology or a reference to a specific instance that describes the reason.

binding.description: SNOMED CT, ICD-10, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

element.short: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?
element.definition: The outcome of the procedure - did it resolve the reasons for the procedure being performed?

element.short: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the procedure description, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.
element.definition: Any complications that occurred during the procedure, or in the immediate post-performance period. These are generally tracked separately from the procedure description, which will typically describe the procedure itself rather than any 'post procedure' issues.

binding.description: ICD-10, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

element.short: Device used to perform the procedure
element.definition: Device used to perform the procedure

element.short: Device(s) that is/are implanted, removed, or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.
element.definition: Device(s) that is/are implanted, removed, or otherwise manipulated (calibration, battery replacement, fitting a prosthesis, attaching a wound-vac, etc.) as a focal portion of the Procedure.

element.short: Additional information about the procedure
element.definition: Additional information about the procedure
